climbs.name: Yankee Doodle Dandy
climbs.fa: Gary Sullivan, Laeger and Bob Paserini   June 30, 2006

content.description: This route is approximately midway on the Southwest face of Punk Rock.  Two bolts past hard climbing (crux) leads a brief arch then launching into stiff climbing (12-) all the way to the top.
content.location: The main feature are the two bolts to an overlap found largely in the middle of the wall.

content.description: begin on a bushy ledge 5 feet above the ground. starts at a large roof. clip the bolt and pull the roof to interesting slab and 3 more bolts. crux is the top 2 bolts. after clipping last bolt, route goes into a dirty ramp up and left that leads to the same anchor as a bolted Unknown 10c(R) left of this route.
content.protection: quickdraws. rap rings on anchor up and left on the ramp. another set of anchor bolts without rap rings exists on the arete at head height once arriving at the ramp.
content.location: At the far southern end (right-most bolted route) on Punk Rock's Southwest Face.

content.description: Bolted by my Central Coast hero, Brandon Thau, quite a while ago. This Punk Rock project needed some attention. The route begins with some very tricky face climbing centering around two spaced knobs and feet that sometimes feel like they don't actually exist. Solving this puzzle is the main crux and leads to an amazing technical seam that sometimes opens up to decent holds and requires some delicate very fun climbing. Grade unconfirmed, go try it!
content.location: On the far left side of the Southwest Face of Punk Rock. Find the line of 5 bolts that lead you past a small shallow right-facing corner.

content.description: Left facing corner to overhung fingers to wide with slots for hands throughout. Good short and stout.
content.protection: Cams to 2 inches, bolted chain anchor on top of P1.
content.location: Distinct left facing corner to the right of Yankee Doodle Dandy.

climbs.name: Reach for the Sky
climbs.fa: Kodas, Swanson, Summer, 1985? Long in use when 3 bolts placed in 1988

content.description:
A variety of techniques required. 3rd bolt needs replacing.

All the info I had written and verbal at the time was for 1 pitch. It appears there is a 2nd pitch which earns a 5.11a rating. I have no information or experience about the 2nd pitch. Neither I or any in the party I was with could see any evidence of the route continuing. Latest guide indicates a bolt and anchors.
content.protection: 3 b's plus finger sized nuts and cams. A 4“cam for large pocket. Belay has 3 B's and chains.
content.location: Approximately middle of W face, left of large flake at about ground level.

content.description: Follow the thin arching crack up and left to the bolted slab above.
Another good one on Punk Rock. Starts up an easy ramp to a sporty vertical section (crux) Then follows a crack up and left. Then 2 more bolts to the bolted anchor.
content.protection: Two bolts on the bottom and gear behind a flake for the next 30 feet or so before 2 more bolts and a bolted anchor with rap rings.
content.location: Left most of the 5 bolted routes on the right of the dome.
